segments.text: I can’t believe how careless the woman is being, completely fixated on that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sink is overflowing, and she’s almost standing in the puddle inches from her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s insane to think that she doesn’t see the chaos unfolding behind her back.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy climbing on the stool is a recipe for disaster; it’s unstable and he’s reaching too far.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a rush of frustration for the woman; how can she be so oblivious?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl looks so hopeful, her little hand reaching up for a cookie; it’s sweet yet reckless.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: There’s an innocence in her anticipation, but the situation is anything but innocent.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This scene is a perfect storm of misplaced priorities, like a disaster waiting to unfold.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I try to picture the consequences if the boy falls; it gives me a knot in my stomach.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I want to scream for her to look, to be aware of what’s happening right next to her.
segments.speaker: PAR
